Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DanaVO
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel in the center of Rome. Breakfast was a little poor, but enough for the beginning of the day. The hotel is located on a safe street, very close to Termini, which is the central subway and bus station, very important for turists. Our room was cleaned every day, the sheets and towels were perfectly white and changed daily. Great value for money hotel, would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “It's bearable but great location”
Reviews.Author: St3ff
Reviews.Content: The elevator needs to be condemned to the dead, the breakfast is marginal and the single beds are like rock. The location is great but the managers are grumpy buggers. There's got to be a better bang for your buck. the last time I was here managers bent over backwards to help out. What happened?

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome........”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about staying here! OK, we were a party of 21 in Italy for rugby in February and it snowed, but I thought the whole place was jaded and un-loved. The escalator was so slow it was quicker to amble upstairs and the breakfasts were a curious mixture of terrible machine brewed coffee and hard-boiled eggs. The bread was fresh on the Saturday but that's the best i can say. Inexplicably for a rugby tourist group they were always reluctant to open the bar, but they caved in on the Saturday and Sunday nights. Our room had a fabulous view of the office building next door and althought the sheets and towels were clean the bathroom left a lot to be desired in terms of a showering experience. I cannot complain because a great team at Bowdon Rugby Club did the organising, but when i return to Rome I won't be staying at the Giglio dell'Opera (although it is very handy for everything including the railways station!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sergio B
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Breakfast could be better. They charge 2 euros per hour for the wifi internet.

Reviews.Title: “Winter weeek inRome-including the rugby!! The Harrisons”
Reviews.Author: Sueharri
Reviews.Content: My husband and i spent 5th to 12th February at this hotel. Ok so its dated but it was warm the rooms were immaculate including the bathroom. Our towels and linen were changed daily and we found the staff very helpful and the breakfast more than adequate.I noted some people in their reviews complained about the reception staff but i found the attitude of some guests to the staff would make a saint swear! The location is absolutely wonderful giving access to the station the metro and the buses and some superb eating places. We would like to thank the staff for their helpfulness and for making our stay both comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GreyTraveller69
Reviews.Content: A group of 20+ of us, all males of mature years, stayed here 3 nts to see rugby international. While many things fall short of perfect, I found it adequate for the purpose. I'd like to say "good for the price" but as our package included flights I don't know what the hotel costs. As others have said, the lift is very slow, the receptionists generally grumpy, shower outlet wobbly, etc etc, but nothing to say don't go. Breakfast was limited in range (basic ham, cheese, boiled eggs, some jams and pre-packed pastries) but always plentiful, and coffee from machine wouldn't qualify a barista, but adequate. Water in shower, from my experience, was consistent in flow and its temperature - although it didn't need cold water in the mix, it was certainly hot enough. (Others in the party, later risers, did say the temp dropped.) We had three in our room: two singles and a fold-out and my bed was absolutely fine, though my friend found his hard. The bedding was clean and well-pressed. The room ceilings are high and the decoration is a bit (a lot!) tired. I had no complaints about the cleanliness of the place. The weather was freezing with a lot of snow and sleet, but our room was warm enough. (One friend in the fold-out in another room was cold at night and got some extra blankets. TV limited channels - about 5 mostly italian with one BBC World news. It's not very near any of the major sights (apart from opera house) but is local to the main railway station and the metro. All in all, don't pay a premium price for this place but, if you want a reasonable base then it seems OK to me. It probably depends on what you're used to.

Reviews.Title: “Nevermore, the worst hotel of my entire life”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo M
Reviews.Content: The room service is ok; Poor breakfast; Smelly bad; Trash elevator; The room is very old, bad taste, and same itens are broken, like tv remote control, air conditioner; The water of shower sometimes became cold; Stay away from this hotel; Wi-fi is paid, 2EU an hour, and the signal is very low at the room.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Alex E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. Do not go there, you will regret long time. The hotel have heating system only in a few rooms, they gave us a good room after 2 poor rooms. Do not go there in winter, the answer of butler was: we don't have heat in rooms, and the answer of receptionist was: it's a law in Italy which doesn't allow us to have more than 22 degrees in rooms. Also the receptionist with glasses was swearing us in italian language...ALL IT'S AWFUL, and I don't exaggerate on this... I am a man,

Reviews.Title: “Can be better”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: Excellent location 10 minutes away from Colosseum and walk distance from Main Station in Rome. Room was clean and spacious by the standards of old Rome, with fine picture and well decorated. Breakfast was sufficent , but they can do better offers. Staff were helpfuk and polite Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Not brilliant - but Rome made up for it!”
Reviews.Author: CarolynBanks
Reviews.Content: The Grand, it ain't! But honestly, if you are on a budget like us and want a hotel close to the station with a good variety of relatively cheap eateries on the doorstep, then you don't do too badly. The room was clean and cleaned regularly and the shower hot and constant. Ok, the toilet seat wobbled alarmingly but we could live with that. The room had probably last been decorated in Mussolini's time but had once been quite grand. We could only find three Italian channels on the TV but actually picked up a lot of Italian from them, which can't be bad. The lift floor was a bit suspect and we tended to stand around the edge. The breakfast was adequate but I wouldn't recommend the fruit juices! And the welcome? It was polite if a little indifferent - I felt more a cash cow than a venerated guest!! But Rome is wonderful - intimate and inviting with buildings of warm, soothing colour and delightful surprises around the corner; amazing architecture and stylish residents. Don't miss the views and the peace of the Borghese Gardens, truly an oasis.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok- but you don't come to Rome to stay inside :)”
Reviews.Author: rc1840
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very dark inside but we didn't really mind because at least the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Bathroom was also adequate but every time someone took a shower, the glass door would leak water and it would get flooded. I felt bad for the poor housekeeper who had to clean it afterwards. The one thing that stood out for me was when it was time to leave (a very early morning), the concierge called up a taxi for us and brewed some good italian coffee for me and my friends. I love that kind of hospitality. Will probably stay again when I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “very poor hotel......”
Reviews.Author: dariochan
Reviews.Content: i write this comment in english because probably not only italians tourists would "enjoy" the giglio hotel. very dark hotel, close to the central station , bad exterior signage, room very old and humble. A/C out of order (30°c in town!!), television with only 3 channels , at the front desk nobody solved these matters . the breakfast? low quality and unfreshness.... i called my agency and asked to don't book again this hotel in a future, even though no vacancies in the rest of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: dimvel
Reviews.Content: nice rooms, bad breakfast but close to bus and metro stations

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Libby37
Reviews.Content: Having read preview reviews I was unsure as to what to expect from this hotel. However I can report that my friends and I found it to be great value for money hotel. The rooms were good sized, bedlinen towels changed daily. The fittings are a little dated but functional-the staff were cheerful and very helpful.Amiz, the night porter, was great at suggesting places to visit and good company after a hard day sightseeing. Although close to the station we didn't hear any noise as good double glazing.We skipped hotel breakfast as we aren't fans of machine coffee but loads of places to have breaksfast on doorstep. Piazza Navarone is a 10Euro taxi ride away and a good place to spend an evening. A great budget hotel and we had a great stay-Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Surprised that it is not last in rankings”
Reviews.Author: inhmn
Reviews.Content: Not functional A/C, dirty, noisy, with impolite personnel, poor breakfasts, I don't have enough words to describe how unpleasant the stay was. Book only if it's last option.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel of my life to-date”
Reviews.Author: ShipraC
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Had a terrible first night Non-functional AC . the kids were crying throughout the night. We were moved to a suite next day. it was better than the earlier room, but still the bathroom was not cleaned properly and the AC was not at all effective in 40 degrees. the bed linens were clean but hotel room smelled of mildew. there were no apologies from the hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth even half the price”
Reviews.Author: Wael S
Reviews.Content: We reserved online 3 nights in hotel but after the first night we checked out and went to the Atlantico Hotel, just around the corner for a better room at the same price. We should have left the first day but we were a big family group so decided to ride it out for one night. First as soon as you get the the hotel you are met with about 10 steps to reach the elevator and front desk. The rug is suppose to be red but it is black and smelly. The staff is ok, not that friendly, except the bellboy that was very helpful. The elevator is very small, like most old buildings in Europe, but as soon as you get in the wooden floor sinks and you feel like you will fall through. I rode the elevator with my feet on the edge just in case. There is no A/C on the hallways and the one in the room does not work well. The room is old fashioned but not well kept. There were busted walls and tubes coming through the roof. The bathroom was small. The shower was smelly and when I looked closer the courtain was full of fungus. That was enough for me to get the heck out of there without even having a reservation anywhere else. When checking our they charged us another 35 euros for cancelling the rest of the days.

Reviews.Title: “We came in August 2010, and it was much better!”
Reviews.Author: shionababe96
Reviews.Content: When me and some of my school in Year 6 came last year, it was brilliant! There was no mould whatsoever, it was as clean as ever and the service was fantastico! We had a great time there! We had to walk to a restaurant nearby for meals, but it was nice to see the streets of Italy nearby. The beds were incredibly comfortable, and I don't know what you were saying about wake up calls etc! It was absolutely brilliant, and I'm sure they've done more, and I'm sure I'LL be back someday! They weren't putting anything up at all, so you must be making it up for money or something. Shiona (Sho-nah) 12 on Tuesday 26th July Went on school trip Year 8 in September 2011 Had an awesome time Would love to go back sometime! :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D :D

Reviews.Title: “This hotel SUCKED!”
Reviews.Author: BabbalyBoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. The elevator was tiny and broken. The rooms were dirty. They brought the breakfast a day before from who knows! Never go there. The only possible good thing is the location. But there's a nice hotel right next to it. DON'T waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel...AVOID!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MeriM80
Reviews.Content: Do not belive the pictures in internet!!! The hotel is very poor, bad smelling, needs to be renovated!!! Terrible breakfast, dark rooms...AVOID IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MCCBelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a leader of a school group and for a 3 star hotel, you get what you pay for. Rooms were a fair size for Rome, although they did vary considerably. The rooms were very clean and the staff were very welcoming. Breakfast was less than desirable with the most horrendous coffee ever, but the rest was edible if not exactly appetising. Location was premium with just a few minutes to either Termini or Republic train stations. I'm sure there are likewise other hotels that could provide better facilities in a quieter location (front rooms were noisy) but you pay your money and take your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not thay here”
Reviews.Author: NVLC
Reviews.Content: We just had 5 weeks in Europe, staying in a different place every 1 to 2 nights and this was the only hotel we DID NOT LIKE AT ALL. The staff were very unfriendly, to the point of rude. Even when they changed staff it made no difference - they were all rude. Our room was made up as a twin room even though we booked a queen bed so they pushed them together and changed the linen. This would have been OK except the beds were slightly different heights. The hotel is very tired and our bedroom door was rickety on its hinges making it difficult to lock. The lift was very small and broke down once (we were only there 2 nights) and the floor in the lift felt very unsafe, moving under your feet. The only redeeming feature was the location which was close to the station but so are many other hotels - so take my advice and stay at one of them Lorraine and Norm Gold Coast Australia

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service at check in- grossly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nancy181780
Reviews.Content: This hotel was supposedly 310 euros a night but we booked it on late rooms and paid 80- still too much. Front desk was rude ( very rude). The bell man/ bartender was very nice though. Close to train station but pay the extra and stay closer to central Rome in a smaller hotel with a/c that works.

Reviews.Title: “Remember Basil Fawlty?”
Reviews.Author: Hearts-Of-Thirsk
Reviews.Content: A "plastic" breakfast is provided in windowless, airless cellars deep underground. We had two bedrooms because the first double bedroom had non working air con - we complained three times before any action. We were "promoted" to a suite. This was nearly as bad, with poor air con but less street noise. The bathroom presented it's own entertainment with anus and silverfish ! The lift was a work of Roman art. Incredibly slow it was only safe to stand on the circumference as the centre area had collapsed and felt unsafe to stand on. The only good thing about the hotel was it's proximity to the main transport terminus for bus, trains, metro and tours as well as a wide variety of tourist eateries.

Reviews.Title: “a cheaper hotel with a no frills service - perfect location and easy no hassle stay”
Reviews.Author: GbBazil
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveller i was not looking for the most splendid accommodation and wanted a balance of price v's location with breakfast included. The hotel proved to hit my needs perfectly. I would stay here again. Rooms were basic and clean. My first room had no safe so i was immediately moved on request with no problems at all. in fact i had the choice to have one of a number of rooms - this was pleasing. Shower was a power shower and the water was always hot when i needed it. I am used to staying in Italy so know that the star system doesn't seem to reflect what we may consider worthy in England. With that in mind if you want high class with all the frills go for no less than 5 star. As for this hotel it was perfectly suited to a solo or couple traveller who needed a base to go from and explore. I spent no more than 6 hours in my room at any 1 time. The breakfast was basic (boiled eggs/cornflakes/fresh rolls/fresh bread/jams/honey/juice/tea/coffee/not fresh croissants in packaging) but as i wanted to go out and have at least one breakfast with the locals in the bars i didn't worry and when i did eat it was more than fine for my basic needs. Thank you to the staff for making my stay stress free and easy. Hopefully see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!”
Reviews.Author: DbCb_1990
Reviews.Content: While the location is near the termini station and the room was nice enough, this hotel is the pits. Overpriced, terrible staff and they charge for wifi. The concierge tried to force us to pay up front in cash, and then insisted that there was hot water, when we had been taking cold showers for 2 days. Definitely give this one a pass.

Reviews.Title: “terrible trouble”
Reviews.Author: tsarpetro
Reviews.Content: our bags stolen in reception check in! the receptionist asked our voucher even my name was written on a paper ..it was just for to close my eyes by making me busy while our bags in process of disappearing in check in time at the reception place! our bag stolen..our passports..credits card and all! it was our last day in italy!we were going to stay our last night in italy rome after floransa.pisa venice milano cities!and we had big troubles..what is funny? the receptionist says there was nobody behind back of you! you did not come with 4th bag.....i asked them about check cameras!he told us it s not working in sundays...other one said it is not repaired yet..other one say another thing..italian mafia! 1000 euro charged from our stolen credit card from which we were late block..500 euro cash..lots of equipments of my cameras! sunglasses..these r nothing..what about being without passports in a foreign country! it was big disappointment! and even i have not had such trouble in this rome hotel! it would be still very bad experience for me in such a nice holiday..because rooms re terrible! its like prison..dark and make you feel like prisoner! i do not who are those unlucky people to share his destiny for some couple of days in this hotel! we r going to complain here about not to keep our safety in our trip..because we are absolutely sure about our bad is stolen in reception check in!.. its just your choice after my words! have your grave experience before your DEATH!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ripperz198
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went here for 8 days for valentines week feb 2011. The hotel was is a great location soooo close to everything which was brilliant, Rooms were clean and it was cheap so you cant complain, some of the reviews i think are over the top i had a great time, called cabs for me when needed and they told me how much it would cost in the hotel which was handy. Breakfast was basic but ok to keep you going, didnt have any problems with the coffee was always hot, it came from a machine so if they only just really got that i dont know. rooms were clean, i had trouble sleeping a bit uncomftable but my girlfriend had no trouble so maybe that was just me. 8 days cost £358 which was cheap so cant really moan. the lift needed a bit sorting if you stand in the middle the floor feels like its going to fall in lol so stand at the sides other than that i really enjoyed it expecially the collesium was amazing will go again and stay in the same hotel. like i said tho some people i think have gone over on the review about how bad it is, just remember your only sleeping there, if your going rome its all about the sights, we didnt go in the room during the day, woke up went out came back late and slept. have a great holiday, rome is lovely

Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: andrea197960
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute based on price and location. The room was small but with private bathroom and TV facing the street. The hotel is located close to public transportation which was great. Breakfast was included but you have to wake up before 10 to get it. The staff was ok but when our friend from Rome came to visit us the receptionist didn't let him up. We were upset about it. He showed him his id etc but there was no discussion. They kept our bags after checkout which was nice. The price is relevant to service.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for a budget stay”
Reviews.Author: sunloverkel123
Reviews.Content: just returned from 5 days in rome. This hotel is basic, however was a bargain. In terms of location you can't beat it. Walking distance to all the big sites apart from the vatican - however very close to the buses etc... Lots of places to eat - try the manti round the corner - excellent food and unlike all other places in the area is not designed just for tourists ( little english spoken, no tourist menu, excellent value - in other words a jem!). Back to the hotel - yes it is a bit tired however it is old and just needs a bit of loving care. Rooms were clean and in our case very big, staff were very friendly. As we are independent we prefer to find things ourselves, sometimes it works such as the above resturant.. other times not so much... i would say always go down the back streets, great little pizza places - sandwich/pizza + wine = 10 euros for two! be careful when ordering beer.. very expensive in rome, worse price charged was a bar near st maria 32 euro for two drinks! however wine is very cheap - most places do there own house red/white for 8 euro and it tends to be excellent. Everyone would try to sell you the roma pass, for ourselves we found it cheaper to pay at the sites as public transport isn't needed. One tip - on most occasions a guided tour is not needed however in the roman forum well worth the money as there are little to no signs explaining the sites, so you end up walking around looking at rocks.... Also make sure you visit san giovanni in laterano, the pope's first church.. overlooked by most and looks closed from the outside, but this is a stunning church. If i returned to rome i would return to this hotel as it was a great deal - £150 for 4 nites for two people, excellent value and a good overall base. The one negative the breakfast is as bad as they say...saying that i don't like breakie, and there is many cheap, good places near by to get a proper coffee and a danish.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: staybeautiful123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as part of a school group. It was in a great location close to the metro station, the communal areas were very nice and the staff friendly. The stairs were hard to carry bags up and we stayed on the top floor. I stayed in a room with three beds, it was very cramped. Additionally, two of the beds were made up as a double which I would ahve complained about had we been there for longer than one night. The other bed was a camp bed which (according to the person who slept in it) was very uncomfortable. I slept well. The breakfast was dull and not very nice. However the hotel was clean and reasonable comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A poorly presented hotel with little customer care and attention”
Reviews.Author: HeathIan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I plus 2 young children stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is generally poorly presented and the list of services does not always match those available (no mini bar or balcony as advertised, no free WIFI). Our room was dirty (various surfaces (desk, mirror, lamp, vanity counter in the bathroom) had not been cleaned. There was no plug on the wash basin chain allowing objects to fall in to and block the sink whilst washing. The TV remote control did not work and TV channels had poor reception. There were also many finger and hand mark stains on the walls and wall paper was peeling off. Breakfast fare was limited; one type of cereal, one ham, one cheese, no fresh pastries, no fruit, no yoghurt, luke warm coffee from a machine, non-fresh orange juice served in plastic cups. Most worryingly, there was no emergency information in the room or corridors on the upper floors and only one means of escape in the event of fire. Also, there were no other information leaflets or books available in the room giving information about services available, numbers to call etc We tried to register our complaint/concerns on each day we were there and were promised the manager would respond; he neverdid. Customer care and concern for these issues was absent. This was far from being a 'superior 3 star hotel'.

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff for this money”
Reviews.Author: Mmango25
Reviews.Content: We spent in Rome 3 nights and 4 days. The most important characteristic of this hotel is its GREAT location. Just 5 minutes walking from the Central train station of Rome ("Termini") and 7 minutes from the Bus Shuttle (of both Rome's airports) 3 minutes from the SightSeeing Buses, and Metro station (crossroad of the two subway lines). 20 minutes walking from the Colosseum. Almost all famous Rome's sites are available even without public transport. The room facility is not in the best condition - the air-conditioner was terribly noisy and we had to switch it off at the nights, fortunately the temperature was acceptable. It was impossible to tightly close the bathroom door, when you are releasing water from the bath it suddenly appears leaking on the floor, the flush button of the toilet sometimes does not work. And the staff might be more benevolent. But still, the rooms were clean, there was a safe box in the wardrobe, the breakfast was not great but acceptable (except of the always cold coffee from the coffee machine), and again - location, location, location. I would order this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “For Poor Customer service come here”
Reviews.Author: NMA20
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from Rome today and wanted to put on a review of this hotel. To give it credit the location is actually quite good - 4min walk from the main train station (Termini) and is about a 20min walk from many of the main attractions. The rooms are just ok, poorly decorated and basic (fine if you just want a roof over your head during your stay). The hotel breakfast is very minimal (bread, boiled eggs, ham and cheese or some cheap cornflakes -thats all!). I asked the receptionist on Sunday morning about local markets to which he simply said 'you have missed them' he did not attempt to try and help suggest something else! he then turned away and did not engage any further. Also, on another day when asking the receptionist if he could confirm that the cinema that was 10 min walk away from the hotel showed films in English he said he did not know and that was it. We asked if he would mind phoning the cinema for us as it was raining, he huffed! but eventually did try (FYI: the cinema that does show films in English is a few mins walk from the Flaminio station). All in all the hotel is very basic and could be improved very easliy by having staff show a little more interest in their guests who are are visiting the city and bringing them business.

Reviews.Title: “Book At Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldenmumkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for 3 nights. It is VERY close to Termini station which is great if you are arriving or departing by train. Could not here noise from train station. On a cute street, but I find Rome quite charming. Hotel booked for us by another family member and was QUITE nervous about staying here due to the reviews I have read on Tripadvisor. So, I was prepared for the worst, and it ended up not being so bad. When we first arrived there were 2 creepy front desk men so I was a little concerned and happy that I had a room with my husband. We had a triple room the first night and it was quite big. Had seen pictures of mould on TA and you could definitely see it in the bathroom (at least where it had been on the ceiling, they did try to cover it up). Sheets were clean so was able to get some sleep!!! Switched into Mother-in-Laws room next night, as the men went to southern Italy for a night and we stayed to sight see in Rome. Room was okay but shower curtain was mouldy and remnants of scraped mould in bathroom. Also, mother-in-law lost her wallet, either got stolen on the subway, or she left it on her bed and cleaning staff stole it. Not sure, but just BEWARE of stolen things from your room in this hotel. Next night husband and I had our own room. It was beautiful. All new bathroom, marble floors etc, clean, no mould anywhere, If I had stayed in this room the whole time I would have said the reviews of this place were all wrong, but they aren't. Husband and I wanted to go for some drinks and asked the new front desk man where a good place was. He was very kind and full of great ideas. told us which bus to take and drew the walking route out on a map. Also gave us a book of maps of Rome that we were supposed to get but hadn't. Gave us a few different options of where to go. So nice. Got home late and front was locked. When he answered he was very happy we were back safe. So, I think next time I go to Rome, I will definitely book somewhere else due to the first two rooms, however if I had to stay there again, I wouldn't be overjoyed, but I would be okay. Also, the next morning a girl who was staying at the hotel was yelling at the front desk man (the one from the first night) about how her stuff had been rummaged through and stuff was stolen and saying that this was supposed to be a 3 star hotel and expected 3 star service. Basically, don't fret, just put your money in the safe and be smart about it. I imagine stuff goes missing all the time in Rome. Oh yeah, breakfasts were terrible. Be warned that the juice needs to be watered down or better yet, stricken from the menu. Button-press coffee machine, need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base, especially if you're...”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTemple
Reviews.Content: An ideal base, especially if you're coming in on the train. Decent rooms and service, though hotel needs a 'lick of paint'.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! Expensive and terrible breakfast, dirty bathrooms and smelly rooms!”
Reviews.Author: bel80
Reviews.Content: Really didn't enjoy our stay at this hotel. It is apparently considered 3 stars, but is more like 1-2 star rating in our opinion! The room we had was very smelly, and the carpet looked like it had not been changed since the 70's! The blankets were very dusty and smelled of some sort of odour, and the bathroom was not clean at all! We actually found our floor matt fully wet when we first entered the bathroom. There is also not enough hooks to hang towels, clothes. Breakfast was terrible! The only edible thing was the pre-packaged croissants! Coffee was awful, and so was the fruit juice. They seem to be currently doing renovations as the walls have been newly done. However, the location is not bad, as it is only a short walk away from the main station, and the airport bus service.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: kingfisherCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I would not even rate this hotel as a backpacker hotel. Terrible room. Water was either cold or boiling hot. Staff unpleasant and unhelpful. Breakfast not even continental, terrible orange juice, instant coffee, rolls and blue boiled cold eggs. If this is 1st world accomodation at 200 euro per night, come to South Africa and get 5 star treatment for the same money. I am happy for this hotel and Rome to stay in the hands of the rude Roman people. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Should not command more than €50 per night.”
Reviews.Author: Birrel35
Reviews.Content: What a disater, spoiled the Rome experience for us. A real backpackers joint. Could have done much better at the asking price after asking around at some other Hotels. Travel agent are going to get a mouthfull when we get back.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Buelligan
Reviews.Content: A good price for a well located hotel in the middle of one of the most expensive towns I have ever been to. But decorations are tired. Sheets clean but blankets doubtful. Shower bracket loose and if you went a hot shower be up before nine and it gets no warmer later in the day. Breakfast is very poor, all aspects of it. Most of the staff are helpful and polite. This hotel badly needs updating and if done would command prices far higher, so take your pick.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly surpassed our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Rado23
Reviews.Content: After reading all of those negative reviews, me and my girlfriend were really unsettled about what we could expect. From our point of view, negative reviews tend to be quite overreacting. Opera is not a luxorius hotel, but you cant expect such a hotel for such a low price. This hotel is more than worth of what you pay for it. The location is absolutely great, Termini station is like 2 minutes walk from the site. Well, the only negative, we found, was the window, which could not be closed properly and so the temperature in our room was sometimes lower than outside. But we didnt even try to fix this problem because we stayed there during the nights only. In summer that should not be a problem and it is not a general problem of hotel. It was probably a problem of only one particular (unlucky for us) our room. If you are looking for a cheap, greatly located, comfortable and satisfying place to stay for couple of days, this hotel could be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore Negative Reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: KellyLong
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with my parents booked this hotel back in May time without doing any research. The day before we travelled I decided that I would have a quick look at the reviews, BIG MISTAKE. I slept very little due to worrying about what I was going to find after reading these horrific reviews, complaining about filth to items being stolen. We landed in Rome very early, way before check in time. However we thought we would try our luck and go and find the hotel to see if the room would be ready early. We found the hotel and it is in very easy to find location, about a 10 minute walk (if that) from the Termanii (Station). From the outside it looks ok, we went in and asked if there was any chance our rooms were ready? The man behind the desk was slightly blunt and came across slightly rude. However I do think this was a language barrier as he was just very short and to the point. One of our rooms was ready and we were shown to the room via a very small, old lift. The floor of the lift did feel like it was going to fall through, however you can use the stairs but this didn’t stop us using the lift during our stay. This was the moment I was dreading, as soon as we walked into our bedroom I just couldn’t understand what all the fuss had been about. We stayed in rooms 210 and 212 on the second floor, for 2 nights. The rooms were an ample size, not at all small as some people had written. I checked the bed sheets, all beautifully clean, I checked the bathroom, shower, toilet, towels all wonderfully CLEAN!!! Even the towels smelt fresh and soft. I’m a cleanaholic and if there is a slight bit of dirt I will spot it a mile off and both our rooms were far from unclean. Granted the decor is a little tired and not to my taste, but its clean. And the view from our window was not the best, but I wasn’t in Rome to be starring out my hotel window. The only problem we had with the room was our shower, even though it was very powerful and hot, the shower tray drained very slowly and you would end up in ankle depth water and the shower head would sometimes fall. They had some strange hand towels in the bathroom that were more like a small sheet than a towel but the bath towels were fine. The bedroom and the bathroom had tiled floor which is easily kept clean, with carpets you never know what’s living in them. The pillows could have been better, but for 2 nights they were fine. In the morning we went down to breakfast and again was pleasantly surprised. Previous people had described the breakfast room as ‘the dungeon’. It was small but not ridiculsley small, but again it was clean and light ( not dark and dingy like a dungeon). Breakfasts consists of rolls, bread, cereal, croissants(pre packed), boiled eggs, crackers, jams, ham and cheeses. All very lovely. The only downfall at breakfast time was the coffee. I’m used to coffee out of machines, I use these all the time in work, but this coffee was disgusting! It was barely warm and tasted awful, however my parents thought I was over reacting to the coffee as they drank theirs, so it shows how we all like something different. However i do think this must be the way in Rome, i tried several times to get a coffee when out and about and they were all the same. Not once during my stay did I find any uncleanness or mould. The staff could have been a little happier and the reception staff did come across slightly rude but I do feel this was a language barrier. The decor is tired and not to many people’s taste, however you are there to see Rome not the inside of your hotel. It is in an ideal location. From the hotel we walked to the Colosseum, the Pantheon, St Peters and the Vatican. If I went back to Rome I would without a second thought stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One big mistake”
Reviews.Author: Principe7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one out of three hotels I stayed in while in Rome It was by any standard TERRIBLE. To begin with the hotel was suggested to me by a dealer in Termini and I was tired and looking for a quick fix. It was a mistake. I should have asked to see the room in advance. The service man in the front desk seemed suspicious but I only got that later. The room was SO small with no window and smelly. The bath was not very clean and taking a shower was a bad experience. The breakfast wad dull to the point that I sipped a little bit orange juice and rushed to the room for a quick check out. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone not even to my enemies. I would never thought I would fall trap to a dealer at Termini, but I did. At least I had great expereicnce in two other hotels in Rome to balance this one. STAY AWAY plz.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was great!”
Reviews.Author: Noellcakes
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Rome in 2007 was a great vacation. We stayed at Hotel Giglio Dell Opera for one night. The hotel was centrally located, nearby lots of shops, cafes, and attractions. When we checked in, our reservations were met. The elevator was very small and slow, but it worked never the less. The only time we used the elevator is when we needed to transport our luggage. The receptionist at the front desk was very helpful with parking questions, and also called the airport for us because part of our party had lost bags. When the airport was unable to answer questions via phone, the receptionist allowed me to use his computer and internet connection to check the lost luggage website provided by the airport, which, in my opinion, was above the call of good service. The rooms we reserved were near one another (we had a group of 6 people). The air conditioning was not cold, but it definitely helped with the hot temperatures! The rooms were clean. The bathrooms were clean. Nothing fancy. But nice enough as we only needed the room to sleep. For the price, if we ever return to Rome and need to stay in a hotel, we would more than likely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They Steal Here”
Reviews.Author: SoSher23
Reviews.Content: Safe was (possibly conviently) not working, so I left extra money in my suitcase, the cash was stolen, didn't realize till we came home. Saw another review say this, so obviously it's what they do there. They also tried to cheat us on the price of the room, they said $85, but tried to charge us $90 and make us feel like we were being cheap over $5. Dirty, dingy, elevator floor is falling through, dangerous, "buffet" is disguisting, artificial diluted weird juice concentrate and some crackers. Staff is rude.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: lenso
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although well located, is by far the worst hotel I have stayed in. The staff were extremely unhelpful and very rude. They refused to call police when our room was broken into, said it was our problem. We were told they were too busy to fetch our valuables from their safe. The rooms were dirty and very small, so small they were hard to move around. The shower was broken and had no temperature except for scalding. Breakfast was very limited and in a dungeon room. There are plenty of other hotels around Rome.....look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get”
Reviews.Author: RedExile56
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel on two seperate occasions ...February 2009 and previously March 2007. We paid what we expected to pay for a 3 star hotel in a European city. The fact that we returned would imply that we were satisfied with our initial experience. The rooms are small but comfortable. If you want deluxe, don't stay in a 3 star hotel ! The bathroom is also small, old fashioned but practical. The reception staff vary from very friendly - at night - to downright rude - in the mornings. Forget about breakfast - not worth the effort. Will I stay here again .....yes, in two years time, if still as reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty,decaying,depressing”
Reviews.Author: SpikeydogDurham
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel after our Ryanair flight to Liverpool was cancelled.The hotel was recommended to us by the hotel booking desk in Ciampino Airport. This hotel is horrible! The whole place has an air of decay about it.The room was smelly and the bathroom was dirty,mould in the shower and the shower head covered in limescale.The public areas are badly in need of decoration and the carpets in the hallways are dirty. We only spent a few hours in the room as our flight was very early,however this was too long and we couldnt wait to leave .

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: travel4lifeCanada
Reviews.Content: I was part of a tour group that stayed at this hotel and I was very disappointed. The hotel had a musty smell to it on some floors and the bathrooms were not clean and some had mould. Also people staying with us had stuff stolen from the hotel rooms while they were out for the day. Overall I would not want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: chiefWorcsuk
Reviews.Content: Opera Went to Rome with a budget airline on a budget price and stayed at the Giglio Dell Opera.Our hotel room was clean and tidy but the ceiling leaked water in the bathroom.The breakfast was ok with a small choice of food and drink. The staff that we dealt with were friendly and helpful.The hotel is a bit tired but if you are on a budget and pay budget prices it is ok, if you are expecting a Florida style hotel with Florida style breakfast you are going to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “so so hotel but too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Minhao
Reviews.Content: It's just a so so hotel within Termini Station area. Being a 3.5star rated hotel (at least that's what I have heard from booking agency), the hotel does not meet my expectation. Worst thing was the room door does not filter any noise from the stairways and corridors. However, though our room was facing the street, we were not bothered too much by noises from the street. Breakfast is fine but the coffee was produced by a machine and didn't taste so good. Another thing to be mentioned is that the movie on demand service did not work for our room. When asked they only sent somebody not speaking a word of English to us, and that guy could not do anything rather than leaving some terrible body smell in our room. You should use some deostick at least! In a word, not a good hotel for value of money, better options can easily be found.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: locho
Reviews.Content: Avoid ! Stayed there in August 07 for one night . Booked the hotel through the tourist office in Rome 2 weeks before. Booked 2 rooms as was told no large rooms available that could take 2 adults and 3 children. Arrived at hotel and told that the only had one average size room available for 5. Also told that we would have to pay for two rooms even tough we would just be getting one room. The guy on reception was exceptionally rude and totally unhelpful. The 5 of us spent a very uncomfortable night in one room with no air con and mouldy bathroom. Worst hotel ever stayed in and did not sleep a wink. Breakfast also unedible.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just look at the pictures and read all the reviews submitted by other travelers. The hotel is worse than horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Giglio Dell Opera”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent several days at this hotel. I didn't realize that I had $100 in American dollars stolen from my belongings until I had left there (since I was only using Euro, I didn't check until I was on the train heading to Florence). I was very upset. The bathroom had mold all over the shower, the room was so small that it was hard for four people to share, since then we have stayed in several other hotels and there was a little more room. The breakfast was very slim pickin's if you were a late comer, and they wouldn't get anything else for you if you asked. This was a teriible place to stay, and unfortunately put a bad taste to the beginning of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!!!!!! Read On...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was WAY too expensive for what I got. They were under construction in the hallway - paint, tools, noise and dirt everywhere. There was no hot water in the shower (and I even got to change rooms, no difference, same at night and in morning). The internet didn't work. The air conditioning didn't work. The only thing I can say is the mattress was comfortable and it was close to everything. I wish I had looked on here for a rating first!!!!!! DON"T STAY HERE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome. We were shocked at how expensive the hotels were, so we settled for a middle-of-the-road, close to Termini. The bed was hard and lumpy and we had back aches each morning. The bathroom was in disrepair (broken tiles, clogged sink, lights with no covers) and the shower was grossly overrun with mold. I have never seen such ugly, black mold growth in my life. We asked for wake up calls twice and both got botched. Fortunately, we were awake the one morning so we didn't miss our flight home! Please don't stay at this hotel. And if someone from the hotel is reading, spend some money and clean your act up. Your hotel is in dire need of renovation and cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Cheated - Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I had to get a room in Rome unexpectedly, I stayed here because of it's close proximity to Termini. However, after booking and paying for two nights stay at a reasonable price, I was informed the next morning that the clerk at the desk had made a mistake and charged me the wrong amount. I wound up paying nearly double for my stay because of a mistake the hotel made. I would not have stayed at this hotel for that price, had they told me up front. I was very dissatisfied with the way this situation was handled, and I left feeling cheated and taken advantage of - DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ambberrama
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience here. I arrived and paid for two nights. Then, the next afternoon they told me that the second night would not be the price they originally told me, but that in fact it would be nearly twice as much!!! THEY LIED ABOUT THEIR RATES. Of course, it was too late to try and find a different hotel, so I ended up stuck there. They were very rude. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing mould growth!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: julesfromSomerset
Reviews.Content: Very shabby,bathroom disgusting with mould i had to clean the tiles before i let my children use the shower, towel rail and loo roll holder hanging off wall.Bed clean, room quiet(or as quiet as it gets in central rome!). Breakfast not worth bothering with,Coffee foul from a machine that did not seem to make the water hot enough.we literally had bread and water for breakfast as it was all that was fit to have.Staff fairly pleasant and helpful.Location very good.

Reviews.Title: “very shabby”
Reviews.Author: shellyshols
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here at it is near Termini station. The location was good if you want to walk from the station. However the hotel was in need of a referbishment as it was very tired looking and not as clean as it could be. Our room hadn't even been vacuumed and the tiles in the bathroom were very mouldy. It was a quiet room though so did manage to sleep well. The breakfast was pretty awful.

Reviews.Title: “Happily surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked before reading reviews and was a little apprehensive. However, my husband and I were happily surprised by the location, lovely furnishings, clean accommodations, helpful staff and safe area with lots of nightime walkers, restaurants, shops etc. The charm of the hotel was evident in high ceilings, wall and ceiling moldings, tiny elevator, marble staircases, old-world furnishings, tiled bathroom, etc. Location within walking distance of Termini station made it convenient (and inexpensive) for all our traveling around the city. We stayed four nights and I would stay there again and recommend it to my friends. 4 and 5 star hotels were in the same area. The breakfast room was pleasant and clean. Food was good. All the photos on line accurately represent the the hotel. They said it was newly renovated and I agree. We got all this plus a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Read the bad reviews but had no problems whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: Gemini71
Reviews.Content: After reading all the previous entries I wondered what I let myself in for!! When we got there we were pleasantly surprised, staff were fine, towels changed etc fine. Following on from one of the reviews, we could see that there was previously a door into the next room, however it had been plastered over and the wardrobe placed in front of it. Breakfast was a bit basic but for the money we paid what do you expect in a large city like Rome? If you book here you will get average accommodation which is ideal for quick access to bus or metro routes, but without the noise that we were warned about. Hope this helps, enjoy your trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: INDEPENDANTTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel in a bit of a rush and then read the reviews. Had I done it the other way round, I wouldn't have booked. I was really worried because I had done the booking for a group of four of us. When we arrived, i breathed a huge sigh of relief because it was fine!!. there were no smelly drains, we we over the main road and it was a little noisy but the ease of public transport more than made up for this. the breakast was nice and the staff were very friendly. i would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Granted, we stayed in 03/04 - I've waited to write this review to protect my credit card from sabotage. The elevator was out of service the entire time we stayed. There was one hard working porter there to carry our bags and he was very polite but all of his efforts could not make up for the rudeness and arrogance of the rest of the staff. The milk in the capuccino machine in the brakfast area was sour. They locked us out of our hotel room one night after the cleaning staff came through - after a hard day of touring Rome and them having to walk up 3 flight of stairs - this was inconvienience for them and they acted as if it was our fault until we finally got the poor nice porter to come help us and he finally got us in with apoligies that housekeeping locked us out. Our last night, the desk clerk advised us we should call a cab to the airport because there was goinng to be a transportation strike the next day. He knew just the guy and would make arrangements for us. The next morning that guy never showed up. But while waiting for him, the hotel consierge insisted on charging us double for our stay - even though we already paid in full and despite our confirmation of having done so. He even refused to call the Free 800# given to me by our travel agent and refused to conceed that it could be their mistake. It took me months to sort out this transaction. At that time, I swallowed my pride and I paid twice because we needed out of there. Funny that despite the general strike we were warned about the morning of - the trains were running on schedule. Maybe this gentelman's cousin drove a cab?? I don't know. We went to Rome with romantic visions and left quite dissapointed largely due to our choice of accomodations. My review - do not patronize this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be so good, but unfortunately it's really bad. It's location is excellent but.... Dirty bath, smelly bathroom (sewers or ventilation??), no hot water, shower head blocked....you name it it wasn't good. Read the other reviews, many are similar. Lots of good hotels nearby though.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giglio Dell Opera for 4 nights in December and after reading the reviews we were a bit concerned. However our stay there was really nice! The public areas were comfortable and clean and the continental breakfast was more than adequate. comprising of tinned fruits, cereals, crustyrolls/bread, hard boiled eggs, cheeses, ham, croissants, jams plus coffee, tea and juices. Our room wasn't huge but it was nicely decorated and spotlessly clean, as was the bedding. The location was really good. Being near the Termini it was quite easy to find on arrival and we were able to walk to all the main tourist attractions once we had got our bearings. The Vatican was a bit further away but a short walk to the Termini and we were able to get a bus there. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Rome and would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying and touring Italy at some wonderful places up one coast and down the other our last night in Rome was a terrible experience. Hotel Giglio dell Opera was dirty, worn carpeting, peeling wallpaper, showers with mold and bathroom floors with stains. The company Tourcrafters that recommended them will never see my hard earned $$'s again. The conditions were deplorable. We stayed throughout Italy with 4 other nights at another hotel in Rome. Beware, you do not have to settle to sleep in filth. You are paying for it! Also the breakfast was straight from vending machines nothing fresh! Coffee...water, juice...water. Nothing had a flavor. There are plenty of hotels around Termini station seek any other one out!

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights at the Opera”
Reviews.Author: eor
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews I almost cancelled my booking at this hotel, but I decided to take the chance. Although the room rate was a little high I found the hotel to match its 3 star rating. The location was ideal for exploring Rome especially with a metro station 2 minutes away. The only real complaint I could have was the room we were given had an adjoining door to the room next door which meant any noise from the room next door carried. Fortunately our neighbours were pretty quiet ( I wonder if they are saying the same about us?). We had no problems checking in or out and our bill was spot on. Overall we found it ok and average by all accounts.

Reviews.Title: “Worst in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Pixel8
Reviews.Content: After touring Italy for an entire week, Rome was my last city and I had to say, was the worst hotel stay ever. For a 3.5 star hotel, this has got to be a joke of quality/standards. USD100+ per night totally wasted. My room (206) was a dump... the second we stepped in, my wife hated it. It felt dirty and old. Ceiling boards had holes and out of place. Toilet had a damp, smelly, musky sewerage smell. Balcony was useless as it was dirty beyond usage. Windows and doors couldn't keep the cold out... toilet was freezing and without heater. Toilet is the barest of looks and the dirtiest at corners and nooks. Carpets look old.... in fact the hotel IS old and feels dirty. We skipped the 2 days breakfast and were never in the hotel till the night for sleep. Reception service was the worst and the most arrogant... no hospitality or concern over our daily complaints of the room. Looking around the same street, there were so many other choices of hotels which we constantly kick ourselves, for not choosing. Too bad for us ... booking and payment was prepaid. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For under 100 euros per night, I thought the Giglio dell opera was pretty decent. We booked three rooms for one night, and after some slight confusion as to how many people the rooms would sleep, we were able to settle in. The next day, they held our baggage in an extra room while we toured the city and waited for our train. The next week when we found ourselves in Rome again, without hotel reservations, we stayed there again. They offered us a decent rate, and accommodated the large group once again. One thing I found odd was that they noticed an extra person in our group of 9 (a friend who was not staying the night, but just visiting with us). THey required that he leave his ID with them at the front desk until he left ("just in case there were any problems"). Then after his train was delayed and he had been there for a couple of hours, they called to make sure he wasn't spending the night. No slipping anything past them! Our second stay there was much nicer- the rooms were on the 4th floor- some had huge balconies, while others were more modest- all were the same price. One more note: the elevator worked but was VERY slow and VERY small. It would have taken us days to get 9 people and their luggage upstairs, so we treked the stairs and it was rough.

Reviews.Title: “capital value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers good value for money - it's located near the main station and 15 minutes walk from Ancient Rome sights. Although some of its decor is faded, it is very clean and comfortable, has pleasant, helpful staff and reasonable bar prices. It seves a good continental breakfast, crunchy rolls with eggs, meat etc. We paid ?60 ($108) for a double room and thought it was a very fair price for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convient and a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Subman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the train station and walking distance to all the major sites. Tip: take a taxi to your furtherest point for the day and walk back. The area was safe. Room was an adaquate size and the beds were comfortable. Did not charge for a 12 year old in a single bed. Breakfast was O.K. The usual cereal, canned fruit, salami, cheese, jam, bread and coffee. Got Good service after leaving a 5 euro tip on our first morning. Wide range of resturants close by. We sent an e-mail requesting a quiet room and the hotel complied. Good thing because the street tho not a major one is noisy. The bath was clean but a little smelly (must be something with the ventilation system). It ain't the Four Seasons but I'd recommend this hotel for those of you on a budget. Our room for 3 was less quite a bit less than $100 per night in November 2002.

HotelInfo.Name: Giglio Dell' Opera
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 14, 00185 Rome, Italy
